title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 May 2012 - XWiki
content:
10:00  has joined #xwiki 10:05  has joined #xwiki 10:06  has joined #xwiki 10:13 <+mflorea> vmassol: should I link images from jira or reattach them to the release notes page? the second option is safer but duplicates data 10:15  mflorea: definitely not link from jira 10:15  :) 10:15  jira is temporary 10:15 <+mflorea> why temporary? 10:16  it's a by product of the development 10:16  just there to organize stuff 10:16  not an end result 10:16  like jenkins 10:16 <+mflorea> sure, but it is also use as a reference, I mean the history is very important, so I don't see is temporary 10:17  if your idea is to use it to document our stuff I'm a big -1 10:17  we have the wiki for that 10:17 <+mflorea> no 10:17  I prefer a single place 10:17 <+mflorea> I was just trying to understand your statement 10:17 <+mflorea> that jira is temporary 10:17  it's temporary in 2 sense 10:18  the one I mentioned and there's another one 10:18  we may move to another tool in the future 10:18 <+mflorea> I see 10:18  anyway our documentation should be self contained IMO 10:18  (ie not rely on external sites as mucha s possible) 10:19  btw re linking from jira, ideally we should put the images on xwiki.org first and link in jira from xwiki.org ;) 10:19  that goes in the direction of the email thread about documenting work on xwiki.org 10:20  (as soon as it's done) 10:20  personally I don't mind when it's done provided it's documented on xwiki.org before the start of the release 10:21  (before, because otherwise it's a release blocking point - that's assuming we want  to improve our documentation which I believe we do ;)) 10:22 <+mflorea> ok 10:22  but 10:22  :) 10:22 <+mflorea> ? 10:22  knowing myself I know that I'll forget it if I don't do it right after I'm done with an issue 10:23  I've been tying to document as I progressed for some time even though I'm not fully there yet 10:23  I'll continue working on this personally 10:23 <+mflorea> :) 10:23  it needs to become a habit 10:23  same as unit tesing has become a habit 10:29  has quit 10:44  has joined #xwiki 11:28  has joined #xwiki 11:31  has quit 12:03  has quit 12:04  mflorea: XR is an app that should be documented on e.x.o, isn't it there already? 12:04  I'm asking because you linked to e.x.o home page rather than to the XR app page in the RN 12:05  I think it's missing but it really needs to be added, do you think you could do that? 12:05 <+mflorea> I haven't worked on XR so I don't know if it's documented or not. Re my link, the fix is not related to XR 12:06 <+mflorea> Thomas is probably the best to document it 12:06  I see ths: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extension+Module+Repository but it's not the right place 12:07  hey I drew the first diagram 12:07  :) 12:07  had forgottena buot it 12:07 <+mflorea> :) 12:09  mflorea: you said: "The speed and reliability of the http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome have been improved considerably." 12:09  I don't understand why you link to e.x.o 12:10  is it to give an example of an XR instance? 12:10 <+mflorea> I said "The speed and reliability of the extension repository have been improved considerably" 12:11 <+mflorea> I can s/extension repository/XWiki extension repository 12:11  ok I think I understand. Let me rephrase it and you'll tell me if it's corect 12:13  is that ok? 12:13  just missing a link to the Extension Repository Application.. I've pinged thomas on skype about it... 12:15 <+mflorea> I'm worried that for a basic user "Extension Repository Application" doesn't make much sense and it's confusing. What's importat for a basic user is that he's now able to browse and install extensions more quickly. Also, from a technical point of view, the XR app wasn't modified, since the bug was in the rest module 12:16  IMO it's still good to document XR and have a link to it 12:16 <+mflorea> ok 12:16  but I understand 12:16  maybe 12:16  has quit 12:17  s/maybe// 12:17  since XR is part of platform 12:17  we need to decide if we want or not to include it in the release notes for XWiki 12:17  normally we should 12:17  but it's indeed potentially confusing 12:18  but maybe with the link it won't be 12:18  since the page will explain what XR app is 12:20 <+mflorea> yes, but it needs to be documented 12:20 <+mflorea> the XR app 12:20  yes this is what I pinged thomas about 12:21 <+mflorea> the positive thing is that some more advanced users will find out that they can setup their own repo 12:22  indeed 12:22  Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r30fd59a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/30fd59ad8eda46380d9f7a3da7473e459a7efcce / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7829: Wording of the empty list of installed application is not nice - http://git.io/VGKOaQ 12:23  has joined #xwiki 12:23  cool :) 12:27  has quit 12:37  hmm trying to remmeber why the following doesn't work: [[image:extension:Extension.Chart [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)]] 12:38  extensions 12:38  :) 12:41  trying to apply the new strategy ;) 12:46  Vincent Massol master \* rbd9898e https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/bd9898e389e4490f2f97480248f99e1aa2f1a4d0 / xwiki-rendering-test/src/main/java/org/xwiki/rendering/test/cts/IgnoredRenderingTestClassRunner.java : [Misc] Improve test description - http://git.io/eMuIFw 12:46  has joined #xwiki 12:48  has joined #xwiki 13:36  added summary report for syntaxes! :) 13:36  http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SyntaxReport 13:44  has joined #xwiki 14:13  mflorea: gentle reminder to reploy to the "[Rendering] CTS Day #1" thread :) 14:14 <+mflorea> ah, right :) 14:14  do you like the latest http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SyntaxReport ? 14:15  (with % completeness) 14:18 <+mflorea> nice! :) you should round the percent to only 2 digits after , 83.3333333300% is a bit too long :) 14:18  yep 14:19 <+mflorea> but it offers a very good overview of the supported syntaxes 14:20 <+mflorea> well, percents can also be misleading (if you don't know the number of tests you might think 100% on mediawiki/1.0 is equivalent to 100% on xwiki syntax) 14:21  why wouldn't they be equivalent? 14:21  I count only valid tests for a given syntax 14:22  has quit 14:22 <+mflorea> sure, they are mathematically, but in reality xwiki syntax is more tested 14:22  I don't understand 14:22  why is it more tested? 14:22  those results are on the CTS 14:23 <+mflorea> how mare tests do you have now in CTS? 14:23  this is why we need the CTS Day #1 14:23  5 or 6 14:23 <+mflorea> ok, what I'm saying is that there are more tests for the xwiki syntax 14:24  sure but again this is only about CTS reports 14:24  not about total xwiki tests 14:24 <+mflorea> I know 14:24  in any case this report doesn't haven any meaning 14:24  till we have the full CTS suite 14:24 <+mflorea> exactly 14:24  which is why I've not advertised it yet :) 14:24  I haven't even linked it from anywhere on rendering.xwiki.org 14:25 <+mflorea> right now from this page I can understand that mediawiki has the same level of support as xwiki syntax 14:25  and this is why I'm pushing for CTS Day and to get help ;) 14:25  has joined #xwiki 14:25  because if we don't succeed in moving our tests to the CTS then all the work I've done so far on this will be for ntohing 14:25  \*nothing 14:25  has joined #xwiki 14:26 <+mflorea> yes 14:26  ok numbers are rounded now 14:26 <+mflorea> for the percentage, you could display xy% (N/M) , i.e. also display the number of tests out of the total number of tests 14:27  yes but this total is ont he right 14:27  where I list all tests 14:28  added test # in the list of tests 14:28  anyway what's important now is to add more CTS tests 14:29 <+mflorea> yes 14:29  the reports seems good enough for now to be usable (we can always improve it later on) 14:33  has quit 14:34 <+lucaa> hi guys, I have an XDOM and I am trying to replace all the rawblocks of syntax html with html macro blocks so that they get rendered properly in syntax 2.0. 14:34 <+lucaa> since I need to tell the macro block constructor whether the macro is inine or not, I was wondering how can I find out whether a block is inline or not from the XDOM? 14:34  has quit 14:36  has quit 14:39  has joined #xwiki 14:39  has quit 14:41  lucaa: I don't remember any utility for that. I remember that in the HTML renderer somewhere I had to create a map for knowing this 14:41  thomas might remember better than me though 14:41  has joined #xwiki 14:41 <+lucaa> a map meaning that you actually need to traverse the tree to compute this information for each node as you pass through it? 14:42  has joined #xwiki 14:42 <+lucaa> so by only having the node you cannot know? 14:42  this is what I have in some HTML util: 14:42      private static final Set NONINLINE\_ELEMENTS = new HashSet( 14:42          Arrays.asList("address", "blockquote", "div", "dl", "dt", "dd", 14:42              "fieldset", "form", "h1", "h2", "h3", "h4", "h5", "h6", "hr", 14:42              "noscript", "ol", "p", "pre", "script", "table", "ul", "html", 14:42              "body", "td", "tr", "th", "tbody", "head", "li", "thead", "tfoot", 14:42              "caption", "col", "colgroup", "legend", "base", "link", "meta", 14:42              "style", "title")); 14:42 <+lucaa> no, not that 14:42 <+lucaa> the xDom blocks I mean 14:42 <+lucaa> now the html one 14:42 <+lucaa> s 14:42  I know what you want 14:42 <+lucaa> ah 14:42  it jsut doesn't exist I think 14:42 <+lucaa> aham 14:42  it would be useful to have that though 14:42 <+lucaa> well, it doesn't exist as a function that's sure 14:43 <+lucaa> I was wondering if I can compute it from something 14:43  not that I know of 14:43  it's ismply about listing the Block types that are inline or not 14:43  so the same list as I've copied above but for Blocks 14:43 <+lucaa> I think it's more complicated than that, no/ 14:43 <+lucaa> ? 14:43 <+lucaa> because for some blocks it depends on the context, no? 14:43  you have an example? 14:43 <+lucaa> e.g. macro block that can be inline or not 14:44  macro is the only special case 14:44 <+lucaa> and you have a function on it to know 14:44  but macros are easy 14:44 <+lucaa> aham 14:44  because you have isInline() 14:44 <+lucaa> yes, so a raw block is of a single type? 14:44  has quit 14:44  all the other blocks are either inline or block elements 14:45  raw block is standalone I think 14:45 <+lucaa> interesting, I didn't know that 14:45  since it can contain anything 14:45  but I don't know 14:45  I may be wrong 14:45  I don't remember that well for RawBlock 14:45 <+lucaa> however, html macro generates a raw block, and html block can be anywhere, inline or block... 14:46  yes indeed so RawBlock can probaby be both 14:46 <+lucaa> but there is no function on it to know it ;( 14:46  by definition of rawblock 14:46  it's a blob 14:47  its content is a black box 14:47  that you pass as is to the renderer 14:47  it's up to teh renderer to make sense of it 14:47 <+lucaa> that I know... 14:47  so at the XDOM level 14:47  you cannot know if its content is standalone or inline 14:48 <+lucaa> yes, but the type of block is not only influenced by what's in it, it's also influenced about where it is placed... 14:48 <+lucaa> or wait, maybe not, I need to think 14:49  no I think you're right for macros 14:49  I vageuly remember an issue 14:49  with macros 14:49 <+lucaa> actually my question is a bit different: if I want to replace all raw blocks with macros, how do I know if the macros are to be inline macros or block macros? 14:49 <+lucaa> can I know that? 14:49  has joined #xwiki 14:51  why would you need to know? 14:51  you can replace with MacroBlock 14:52  and then transform it 14:52  the macro will exeecute 14:52 <+lucaa> but macro block constructor needs isInline parameter... 14:52  and generate something based on whether it's inline or not 14:52 <+lucaa> boolean isInline 14:52  ahah 14:52 <+lucaa> is there another way to build a MacroBlock? 14:52  not really except with a parser I guess 14:53  so indeed it's the parser that know 14:53  if it's inline or not 14:53 <+lucaa> but I would still not know what to pass to the parser because it all depends on the context of the rawblock... 14:53  yep difficult 14:54  I don't have a solution for you right now. I guess what would be best would be to discuss htis with thomas when he's back or create a jira issue about it so that we can disucss it 14:54  has quit 14:54  has joined #xwiki 14:54 <+lucaa> I can have a workaround... 14:55 <+lucaa> just another little question: if the context was "block" for the initial rawblock, and I put it "inline" for the replacing macro block, the only thing that would happen on xhtml rendering is that the macro will be surrounded by a

, no? 14:55 <+lucaa> I mean the result of the macro 15:00  I think you'll get invalid HTML 15:00  s/HTML/XHTML 15:01  sdumitriu: ping 15:01  has quit 15:06  has joined #xwiki 15:06  has quit 15:19  has joined #xwiki 15:20  has quit 15:21  has quit 15:44  has joined #xwiki 15:44  has quit 15:47  Marius Dumitru Florea master \* re27c148 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/e27c148685468f2f06403af7144d0d16c1eb48a0 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-ui/src/main/resources/XWiki/ExtensionManagerMacros.xml : XWIKI-7836: Mark 'Show Details', 'Hide Details' and 'Back to list' buttons as secondary buttons - http://git.io/9tBjbA 15:48  has quit 15:49  has joined #xwiki 15:49 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Pong 15:52  sdumitriu: nevermind, was looking for a tex editor to test our text renderer output and I've found one online 15:52  very nice btw: http://www.scribtex.com/ 15:52  btw it seems that the Tex output we generate isn't fully valid tex output 15:53  it's missing \begin{document}… and quite a few other stuff 15:53  I've fixed locally the new line issue too but I can't commit it till we have a full fledged CTS suite since I can't be sure I'm not breaking other stuff in the latex renderer.... 15:54 <@sdumitriu> Are you sure? I think I just saw begindcoument in there 15:54  I think you dreamed it :-) 15:54 <@sdumitriu> Very possibly 15:54  there is this: 15:54          // if (fContext == null) { 15:54          // println("\\documentclass{article}"); 15:54          // println("\\usepackage{graphics} % for pdf, bitmapped graphics files"); 15:54          // println("\\usepackage{graphicx} % for pdf, bitmapped graphics files"); 15:54          // println("\\usepackage{epsfig} % for postscript graphics files"); 15:54          // println("\\begin{document}"); 15:54          // println(); 15:54          // } 15:54  but as you can see it's all commented out 15:55 <@sdumitriu> Yep, I think that was it 15:55  we'll need to fix this I think 15:55 <@sdumitriu> You can commit in a branch and I'll check it 15:55  but I don't know enough right now to fix it, would need to research it more 15:56 <@sdumitriu> I have a fix for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7819 15:57 <@sdumitriu> I added an isExternalLink method which returns true in AbstractXHTMLLinkTypeRenderer 15:57 <@sdumitriu> With an override in the document, attachment and path implementations 15:57 <@sdumitriu> Actually not in the path one, since it doesn't exist yet 15:58 <@sdumitriu> I have to create it just for this 15:58 <@sdumitriu> Does it sound right to you? 15:59  I don't know, I have written this quite a while ago, I'll need to read the code again 16:04  has quit 16:22  has joined #xwiki 16:41  Vincent Massol master \* r7f63655 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/7f636558170921dbbf6fb157585c67f5d8fceed3 / (2 files in 2 dirs): [Misc] Add table1 CTS test for Tex syntax - http://git.io/xj5DdQ 16:41  Vincent Massol master \* r82f535e https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/82f535ec7cc887f0c64703d106a6dcb7447bc7a8 / (15 files in 14 dirs): [Misc] Improve paragraph1 CTS test - http://git.io/U6e8Og 17:13  has quit 17:19  has quit 17:22  Jean-Vincent Drean master \* r6bb5aa4 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/6bb5aa42783d427675253974ccbbe200d383d006 / (3 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7824 : Filter events fired by hidden documents out of the activity stream - http://git.io/suyF8w 17:42  has joined #xwiki 17:45  Marius Dumitru Florea master \* rc1733c1 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/c1733c19ba4c68b798aafb0f8382ee7724558654 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7247: Display an "upgrade" button instead of an "install" one when an extension is already installed - http://git.io/DtmAWQ 18:42  sdumitriu: you should assign this to you http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-7819 if you're working on it 18:42 <@sdumitriu> Done 18:43  sdumitriu: how is it going on the generate document names module? We're short on time for 4.1M2 now. 18:43  is there a chance you'll have something for M2? 18:43 <@sdumitriu> I've looked at Jerome's code and it seems pretty good for a backend implementation 18:44  cool 18:44 <@sdumitriu> Integrating it 18:44  ok. I need to read up on what he proposed 18:46  has joined #xwiki 18:56  has joined #xwiki 18:58  hi is there a way to link to local file in xwiki like response\_sendRedirect ( local file) 18:59  slugz: sendRedirect does not link to a file, it redirects the output stream 19:00  I want to use extjs as the user interface with xwiki, so i want to like to a local file after login, any idea? 19:01  wdym by "link to a local file"? 19:02  you to read the content of a local file and have xwiki return its content in the servlet output stream? 19:02  so after loging in, i want to open say and index.html file 19:02  s/you/you want/ 19:02  there's nothing to do to serve static files 19:02  that's done by your servelt container 19:02  it's independent of xwiki 19:04  i've seen it done, but not sure how it was achieved 19:04  if a certain user logs in, instead of going to web.home, it opens and html file with extjs interface 19:11 <@sdumitriu> slugz: {{velocity}}$response.sendRedirect('/path/to/file.html'){{/velocity}} 19:12  @sdumitriu what is the root directory 19:12  has joined #xwiki 19:12 <@sdumitriu> WDYM? 19:13 <@sdumitriu> Do you want the HTML file to be stored by XWiki? 19:13  no i don't 19:14  For the path to the file, say on the windows system, it would be ('/c:/etc') ? 19:15 <@sdumitriu> You want to redirect back to a file on the user's computer? 19:15  on the server's computer 19:15  a file on the server 19:16 <@sdumitriu> Well, the file must be served by a server, like IIS or HTTPD or Tomcat 19:16 <@sdumitriu> And you don't point to the location of the file on the disk, but to the URL that can be used to retrieve it from that server 19:17 <@sdumitriu> So you can use $response.sendRedirect('http://myserver.net/index.html') 19:19  I see, i thought there was a way to link files in the xwiki directory 19:19  there's no standard way, that's the Servlet speficiation 19:19  there are hackish ways but they are hacks thus not good to use 19:20 <@sdumitriu> You can put files in webapps/xwiki/resources/html/index.html and the $response.sendRedirect($xwiki.getSkinFile('html/index.html')) 19:22  that sounds good, going to try it 19:26  mflorea: are these breakages correct? http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise41M1#HAPIBreakages 19:26  I think we need to explain a bit more what happened in the RN, WDYT? 19:27  cjd: are these the full CLIRR errors? It seems light and I was sure we would have quite a lot more? 19:28 <+mflorea> vmassol: we discussed about it and I agreed to document the move of WYSIWYG sync plugin to retired. I'll fill the release notes asap. 19:28  thanks mflorea 19:30  Vincent Massol master \* r9109bd7 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/9109bd73c7ddec0496c5a6fb4b8a08c44251b6df / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-classloader/pom.xml : Remove CLIRR excludes since 4.0 has been released - http://git.io/NaoyoQ 19:35  Vincent Massol master \* r1c7a2dd https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/1c7a2dda0052029d80aa7551e8a26fd8767ad3f5 / (2 files in 2 dirs): Remove CLIRR excludes since 4.1M1 has been released - http://git.io/Lwp\_6w 19:37  has quit 19:43  has joined #xwiki 19:43  sdumitriu, it works like a charm, thank you very much 19:43 <@sdumitriu> You're welcome 19:54  has quit 19:54  has joined #xwiki 19:55  has quit 20:05  has joined #xwiki 20:08  has quit 20:27  jvdrean: you've added new API in 4.1 for QueryFilter? 20:28  anwer: yes 20:44  has joined #xwiki 20:51  cjd: I think the RM needs to check a bit more the CLIRR config in pom.xml files during the process. I'm currently reviewing the clirr config now. I've fixed a few places already, and testing more 20:52  I don't know what sergiu scripts does in this regards but this cannot be automated 21:30  has quit 22:32  Vincent Massol master \* r27cfdf4 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/27cfdf434b3072b2d7228ca7bacc94661c8a6b37 / xwiki-rendering-legacy/xwiki-rendering-legacy-api/pom.xml : Remove CLIRR excludes since 4.1M1 has been released - http://git.io/sUynsg 22:33  Vincent Massol master \* r6388c3f https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/6388c3fb99a757932c8156b884ef834cc2cd256c / (3 files in 3 dirs): Remove CLIRR excludes since 4.1M1 has been released - http://git.io/b2t3vw 23:15  sdumitriu: could you document the autotag plugin removal in the RN for 4.1M1? (see thread "[Brainstorm] What do we do with the AutoTag plugin?") 23:17 <@sdumitriu> Ah, right 23:19  has joined #xwiki 23:21  night time, nn 23:21  has quit 23:42  has quit
